column2: and I‚Äôve had it for more than 3 years!";"I installed my ecobee 2 more than 3 years ago. I did have an issue with the first remote sensor
column3: but after contacting support
column4: they sent me an additional one and it works flawlessly. I relocated the original sensor to a room adjacent to the thermostat and it now works as expected also. I have had times where I could not connect with my thermostat via the iPhone app
column5: but I could not connect with other apps at my home at that same time
column6: indicating that my very poor internet connection was temporarily down. I can find no fault with the ecobee app
column7: and I have found their support to be extremely good. They talked me through an issue that was similar to the ‚Äúlearning‚Äù that a competing product performed that I did not want. I would certainly recommend this product
column8: and would definitely buy another if I ever need a new thermostat! However
column9: it seems unlikely that I will need a new one as this one does everything I want it to and more. Additionally
column10: I find this product much more cosmetically pleasing on the wall than other similar products. The LED display is not too bright in the dark
column11: yet bright enough to easily read in daylight.";"2019-02-13T02:46:31-07:00";"https://itunes.apple.com/us/review?id=916985674&type=Purple%20Software";"916985674";209;"en";"POSITIVE"

column1: 1;5616610895;"dj0723";"https://itunes.apple.com/us/reviews/id114241885";"7.29.1";4;"Great until it wasn‚Äôt";"Update from original. They apparently fixed whatever problems and app is working fine again although I haven‚Äôt tried to reinstall the sensor.  Still

column3: the ecobee products don‚Äôt reconnect automatically like all the others. I have to manually reconnect using device. Other than that  happy with product.

column1: My app starting popping up a screen that says one of my sensors is low on battery. I click ok and it says reconnected them comes right back and says low battery again. column2: change temp or anything

I wonder if the Nest product had these kind of issues";"2020-03-04T13:35:07-07:00";"https://itunes.apple.com/us/review?id=916985674&type=Purple%20Software";"916985674";239;"en";"NEGATIVE"

column1: 2;5845084957;"XIXIILXXXI";"https://itunes.apple.com/us/reviews/id108517301";"7.32.0";4;"Good Thermostat
column2: Okay App
column3: Bad Filter Service";"Overall I give the product and services four stars. The thermostat itself functions well. I have no complaints about the device. The app leaves some things to be desired. You can get lost easily in menus and have difficulty remembering where they place each function. The app has been built up over time and could use some spring cleaning and reorganizing. I will also admit that the most recent app update removed all the iconic bee interfaces and replaced them with boring ‚Äòe‚Äô symbols. It definitely shows the device is going mainstream and is killing its unique brand history in the process. That aside beware of the in-app subscription service. They now offer filters direct however
column4: and this is a big however
column5: the filters contain no labeling and I can tell you from first hand experience they do not appear to met the MERV ratings you are paying for. I ordered MERV 13 and based on appearance alone
column6: it‚Äôs a MERV 7 fabric at best. I advised Ecobee of this and they didn‚Äôt even apologize or offer to fix it. There is clearly no satisfaction guarantee or customer resolution practice. All I was told is that they would pass my concerns along. So buyer beware. The devices are good
column7: the app is functional but leaves some to be desired
column8: and the in-app filter service is suspicious and likely fraudulent at this time.";"2020-04-21T13:34:49-07:00";"https://itunes.apple.com/us/review?id=916985674&type=Purple%20Software";"916985674";232;"en";"NEGATIVE"

column1: 3;7862162538;"Fastone1";"https://itunes.apple.com/us/reviews/id31865103";"8.18.0";2;"After years of WiFi issues
column2: can‚Äôt recommend";"I‚Äôve had an ecobee3 lite for approximately four years. While the thermostat generally works fine as a standalone unit
column3: the WiFi connectivity is unreliable
column4: as is the HomeKit integration. The latter isn‚Äôt so much of an issue in my case
column5: as I primarily rely on the ecobee app‚Ä¶when the thermostat isn‚Äôt unexpectedly offline
column6: which is my primary problem.

column1: A quick search will reveal a history of WiFi issues with ecobee thermostats. Perhaps they‚Äôve been addressed in the most recent models; I can only speak to my personal experience. In short
column2: my thermostat goes offline often
column3: and at unpredictable times
column4: for periods of one or two hours or more. At various times over the years I‚Äôve done the troubleshooting set out in ecobee‚Äôs materials
column5: and I‚Äôve followed online tips and suggestions from others experiencing similar issues. Sometimes it appears that the unit is off the local WiFi network
column6: while at others it behaves as though it‚Äôs connected but can‚Äôt reach ecobee‚Äôs servers. Other devices on the WiFi network remain happy and connected. I‚Äôm done going down the rabbit hole.

column1: Given that continuing
column2: unresolved issue
column3: I‚Äôm disappointed in the level of ‚Äúflakiness‚Äù with the unit‚Äôs WiFi connectivity and can‚Äôt recommend ecobee to others. I‚Äôm leaving my thermostat in place for now
column4: while keeping an eye out for potentially better alternatives.";"2021-09-30T08:55:20-07:00";"https://itunes.apple.com/us/review?id=916985674&type=Purple%20Software";"916985674";218;"en";"POSITIVE"

column1: 4;7942410332;"alejandroak";"https://itunes.apple.com/us/reviews/id277666594";"8.19.1";5;"Easy To Use
column2: Mostly Intuitive
column3: Back End / API Rock Solid";"App has been easy to use over the past 2 years. My only complaint is the rate at which the various sensors are updated. I have about 8 temp sensors around the house
column4: and their reported values do seem to take a while to update after the app is opened. Other than that
column5: the iOS app and web portal have been great. MUCH more granular than crappy Nest. Much more data available on the web portal. Glad to have switched
column6: and will continue to use for the foreseeable future. Before buying
column7: I read many reviews and negative feedback about backend/API downtime and reliability. I bought it anyway
column8: and honestly in >2 years the platform has been inaccessible to me MAYBE three times? And for very short periods of time. That's not to say there hasn't been ANY downtime
column9: or that it has impacted others more than me. But I open the application several times per day
column10: and have had really minimal issues. Like I said
column11: glad to have switched. A great product and app combination. Thanks üòÅ.";"2021-10-22T10:42:55-07:00";"https://itunes.apple.com/us/review?id=916985674&type=Purple%20Software";"916985674";177;"en";"POSITIVE"

column1: 5;5923548843;"Michael Caswell";"https://itunes.apple.com/us/reviews/id33053338";"7.34.0";3;"Frustrating sensor alerts";"I generally like my Ecobee thermostats
column2: and the app works pretty well.  But there is one long-standing issue that I find is very user-unfriendly.  Just about every day
column3: various room sensors will become ‚Äúnot detected‚Äù by the thermostat (which prompts an email alert).  Usually within a few minutes
column4: or maybe an hour or so
column5: the sensor will be detected again
column6: which causes another email alert.

column1: This is annoying
column2: but is nothing compared to the hassle that greets me the next time I happen to open the app to make a temperature change... a series of alerts will pop up
column3: a new one appearing each time I dismiss one
column4: until all of the ‚Äúbuilt-up‚Äù alerts since the last time I used the app have been displayed
column5: turning a quick temperature adjustment into a much longer ordeal.

column1: This could VERY easily be solved with an option in the settings to control how long a sensor has to be undetected before an alert is generated.  Yes
column2: if a room sensor is undetected for 24 hours
column3: I want to know about it.  But i don‚Äôt need to receive an alert every time the thermostat doesn‚Äôt hear from the sensor right when expected... let us select how much ‚Äúundetected‚Äù time must pass before we get an alert
column4: as it will probably reconnect within an hour (or less).";"2020-05-09T06:35:52-07:00";"https://itunes.apple.com/us/review?id=916985674&type=Purple%20Software";"916985674";222;"en";"POSITIVE"

column1: 6;7565846507;"368)(";"https://itunes.apple.com/us/reviews/id111338819";"8.12.0";1;"Frustrating change of terms";"We have used our ecobee for the last three years we have lived in our home. The thermostat was installed by previous owners and came with the house. My partner was hesitant about the device when we bought the house
column2: but I assured them it would be an upgrade. We have enjoyed the thermostat until they have now forced use to sign up for their ‚Äúeco+‚Äù program. While many of the benefits are useful
column3: it also enables unilateral control of my thermostat settings by an outside entity. As I have small children in the house and our area reaches remarkably high temperatures
column4: I should not and will not have to justify to any group the temperature of my own home. We try to keep our house moderately cool
column5: with a mind on our power use already. I simply cannot risk putting our kids down for a nap and finding that our ac has been turned off/up to 80+ degrees
column6: which is reported my many users who have already opted into the program. The app has locked me out
column7: stating that I must accept the terms of the eco+ user agreement in order to continue to use the app. As I do not agree
column8: I have stoped using the app
column9: so the utility of the system is remarkably diminished. We will be replacing our thermostat this week with a ‚Äúdumb‚Äù programmable model to avoid future headaches. Thanks for nothing ecobee
column10: you wrecked a good thing with this forced upgrade.";"2021-07-11T15:43:12-07:00";"https://itunes.apple.com/us/review?id=916985674&type=Purple%20Software";"916985674";248;"en";"POSITIVE"

column1: 7;5301918442;"chrisjn";"https://itunes.apple.com/us/reviews/id22217694";"7.24.1";3;"Works but with problems";"I have an Ecobee3 at my house and a latest generation Nest thermostat at my mother‚Äôs.  On paper the Ecobee3 seems like it is better.  More customizations
column2: remote sensors have both temperature and occupancy information
column3: native Apple Watch app (Nest discontinued theirs however there is 3rd party support although Google has caused some problems with that)
column4: Homekit
column5: IFTTT support.  Unfortunately the user experience can be frustrating.  App updates break features.  Ecobee servers go down regularly (either scheduled or unscheduled).  Emails take several days to get a response and the first response will be a canned response without any value.  It will take several replies to their response before you will get a reply that indicates they are paying attention to what you are saying.  They really seem to be trying but it seems to be a perpetually unpolished product.  The Nest thermostat and app generally just work (I‚Äôve only contacted support once and once had to search google for a remote sensor problem).   The Ecobee3 works well enough that I‚Äôm not going to replace it with a Nest (especially after Google‚Äôs takeover and Works with Nest discontinuation).  But if the Ecobee3 died I‚Äôd probably buy a Nest.";"2019-12-21T15:02:32-07:00";"https://itunes.apple.com/us/review?id=916985674&type=Purple%20Software";"916985674";197;"en";"NEGATIVE"

column1: 8;4084043884;"AlexCh.";"https://itunes.apple.com/us/reviews/id42715240";"7.7.0";2;"Worse and worse with every update";"When I bought this product several years ago it worked fine. Really. Always connected
column2: fonts contrasty
column3: right size

column1: 9;6715281141;"kaolinkid441";"https://itunes.apple.com/us/reviews/id1207725894";"7.48.0";5;"Old Dog Learned New Tricks";"This 61 year old man has been proven he‚Äôs not right all the time. I recently replaced my 5.0 ton HVAC unit after 17 years of reliable service. During the back and forth negotiations between the seller and myself
column2: the seller added this WiFi thermostat to the deal. I laughed out loud. I commented that I saw zero value in being able to change the thermostat settings using my phone. The seller just said ‚Äúwait and see‚Äù. This old man was wrong.

column1: There‚Äôs so many things that you can setup on the thermostat right from the phone. I have and will continue to recommend this product to others.

The single biggest question you may have if you‚Äôre reading these reviews is whether it works like it is supposed to. Mine has been flawless. Easy to setup the schedule. Easy to change it. Highly recommended!!!

Side story that makes getting one make even more sense. My wife and I are at two totally different temperatures to be comfortable. She will complain about the temperature and go change the thermostat (she knows nothing about the app). Once a few minutes has passed
column2: I‚Äôll grab my phone and change it back to where I like it. After a few more minutes
column3: I‚Äôll ask her if she‚Äôs comfortable now. 90% of the time she says it‚Äôs much better. The power of the brain!";"2020-12-03T21:55:48-07:00";"https://itunes.apple.com/us/review?id=916985674&type=Purple%20Software";"916985674";229;"en";"POSITIVE"

column1: 10;7113263963;"RandoReviewer21";"https://itunes.apple.com/us/reviews/id21381975";"8.4.0";2;"Nice to Have. Slow load and inaccurate";"It‚Äôs nice to have for remote control and monitoring
column2: but in the year we‚Äôve had it it doesn‚Äôt seem at all accurate. Humidity readings seem accurate but the thermostat won‚Äôt address it when humidity controls are used (I.e. when the humidity is high the system doesn‚Äôt work to get it under control). Additionally

The AC should already been on anyways but now it‚Äôs in overdrive because it‚Äôs so far off the setting.";"2021-03-17T07:34:36-07:00";"https://itunes.apple.com/us/review?id=916985674&type=Purple%20Software";"916985674";201;"en";"NEUTRAL"

column1: 12;6481476998;"tommi deez";"https://itunes.apple.com/us/reviews/id6070377";"7.44.0";2;"Generally ok
column2: recent UI tweak made temperature changes much worse";"The app was generally fine and worked most of the time. However
column3: with a recent update
column4: they made it much more difficult to use the temperature vertical ‚Äúslider‚Äù to say change the temperature up or down a few degrees.

column1: It‚Äôs now much harder/impossible to see
column2: as you‚Äôre sliding the temperature and guessing what it‚Äôs at
column3: where you‚Äôre at until you release your finger. You then have to see what it randomly ended on
column4: then randomly guess how much to slide up or down to go up or down the desired number of degrees. This usually takes like 10 tries to get it right and results in a lot of random temps being sent to you ecobee before you get the right change. It should show AS YOU‚ÄôRE SLIDING what temp you‚Äôre at so you know how much to adjust or when to release.

column1: 13;5960917002;"Wabygayle";"https://itunes.apple.com/us/reviews/id103592758";"7.34.1";3;"The device is awesome
column2: but that app tho...";"We‚Äôve had an ecobee thermostat for close to 4 years. We love it. It does exactly what it says it does. Saves money and provides great controls over household climate.

column1: However
column2: since Ecobee‚Äôs recent push into home security and their logo change
column3: the app has become pretty frustrating. Now
column4: I have to login to the app every single time I want to use it. It automatically logs me out seemingly every time I close it. For something billing itself as quick and easy thermostat updates from your phone
column5: having to go through the login and two factor authentication every time I want to update the temperature in my house seems a bit unnecessary.

column1: Just a tip Ecobee
column2: iPhones have great security features such as Face And Touch ID. Leveraging these features allows users to stay logged in and utilize their built in device security to verify access. It might be a good idea to study up on how to incorporate these features into your app. It just makes sense that cutting edge smart home devices leverage cutting edge iPhone security features.";"2020-05-18T04:54:23-07:00";"https://itunes.apple.com/us/review?id=916985674&type=Purple%20Software";"916985674";181;"en";"POSITIVE"

16;5028112206;"CpOaktonVa";"https://itunes.apple.com/us/reviews/id240428586";"7.20.0";3;"Eco+ service forced on you with no opt out";"I‚Äôve got two of these series 4 in our house and have really liked them until the last month.  We didn‚Äôt buy nest because I just don‚Äôt trust google.
(Prior review material deleted from here forward.)

I‚Äôve updated this review over the last few weeks a few times as I went from a huge fan to being very upset due to their rollout of eco+ and now back to neutral.  Eco+ as originally rolled out required you to accept terms and conditions that gave them the ability to enroll you in power company programs that allow your thermostat to be remotely controlled.  They‚Äôve subsequently changed it so you can decline them and not receive the functionality.  It‚Äôs hard to know if this was just a poorly rolled out feature or if they did it to drive revenue as I would assume they‚Äôd be paid some type of fee for enrolling customers.
In either case
column2: I hope they are much more cautious going forward.  Also
column3: I hope that the eco+ function has an ‚Äòoff‚Äô setting
column4: not just a minimum.  Lastly
column5: unclear if it‚Äôs just my situation but the Alexa functionality that has worked like a dream the last year is suddenly hinkey. Maybe it‚Äôs just a coincidence.

column1: I really hope this company errs on the side of their customer and transparency.  As these devices get smarter and more invasive we need examples of companies that take extra care to leave their customers in full control.";"2019-10-26T19:08:51-07:00";"https://itunes.apple.com/us/review?id=916985674&type=Purple%20Software";"916985674";244;"en";"POSITIVE"

17;5149812121;"I Don't Review Things";"https://itunes.apple.com/us/reviews/id104675655";"7.21.0";5;"Instructions for fixing app after last weeks update";"I see countless reviews reporting the same issue after last weeks update rendered the app unable to connect to the network.  I know because I suffered the same issue and was hovering the reviews hoping to see a response from the developer that was helpful; no luck. Here is what fixed it for me (I am in iPhone‚Äôs latest iOS but hoping this fix works across multiple iOS and perhaps devices):

Go to settings > scroll down to find and select Ecobee > turn on the ‚Äúforce log out‚Äù feature > DO NOT OPEN ECOBEE APP YET > go to home screen and uninstall ecobee app without opening it (this is critical) > reinstall ecobee app > log in now works and you can allow ecobee access to network > FINISH. This worked for me
column2: it may not work for everyone
column3: but I sincerely hope it does. Good Luck!";"2019-11-16T05:19:34-07:00";"https://itunes.apple.com/us/review?id=916985674&type=Purple%20Software";"916985674";149;"en";"POSITIVE"

column1: 18;8057778864;"Audiobeam";"https://itunes.apple.com/us/reviews/id28637208";"8.22.1";1;"Buyer Beware";"I do not usually make comments but I purchased 2 of these smart thermostats last year. Over the summer one of them failed. Called support whom said the unit was bad and it would take 7 days to get a replacement. They ship replacements from Canada. Spoke with a technician on the phone cause I wanted to use my other thermostat as a temporary. They informed me that there was something wrong with my cooling system. Told me to call a HVAC company. Called a company who came and charged me 200 to tell me the wires were hooked up wrong. Called Ecobee to see if they would give me the 200 I paid to a repair man for the mistake Ecobee made but they would not. 25;4131626892;"Ckg77";"https://itunes.apple.com/us/reviews/id25254984";"7.8.0";1;"What happened to the visibility of sensors on iPhone?";"If you have more than three you can‚Äôt see the status of sensors.  The latest update has made the app significantly less usable.

Yet another ‚Äúupdate ‚Äú and the functionality of the app has gone down again. Previously the app replicated the interface of the main unit which was intuitive and functional. Now it barely allows monitoring of a portion of the systems abilities. I am seriously considering switching to nest or something similar to improve the app experience   Very disappointed with the direction the company is taking this app.

Additionally after 4 years there is still no option to manually trigger a data call from a remote sensor. There is still no time stamp or ability to update the information provided by the remote sensors.  So when it says a room is occupied or not you have no idea for how long nor the ability to override the sensors determination.

The most disappointing thing is that it at least mirrored the main device until recently. So at a minimum you could interact with the app the same way you would with the thermostat in the main room. Now that functionality is gone.
I totally agree that this app is less and less useful with each update. I truly do not understand what the direction the developers are trying to move towards.

Please take a step back and understand the damage you are doing to your user base by making the app increasingly more difficult to use and less useful with every update.";"2019-05-10T20:43:47-07:00";"https://itunes.apple.com/us/review?id=916985674&type=Purple%20Software";"916985674";253;"en";"POSITIVE"

column2: slow response time causes users to be punished for their reasonable actions.  You think you are doing one thing
column3: but are really doing another because the app is so far behind.  It has one simple job: set the temperature.  It is incompetent at this.  Loading takes 5-10 seconds.  Changing the temperature takes several seconds to respond.  After waiting for 10-15 seconds for it to respond you try changing it again. Instead it punishes you for actually having done the right thing but jumps all over
column4: overwriting what you were doing to compensate.  This is what is known as a pilot induced oscillation
column5: and demonstrates this app has never hired a single genuine UI designer.  I had these things for years hoping it would get out of the newbie app stage
column6: but I have lost my faith in humanity.";"2020-02-07T20:12:56-07:00";"https://itunes.apple.com/us/review?id=916985674&type=Purple%20Software";"916985674";141;"en";"NEGATIVE"

column1: 95;3769445586;"Nole1977";"https://itunes.apple.com/us/reviews/id43532739";"7.1.0";1;"Reliability has declined since 2015";"We purchased 2 ecobees and 6 additional sensors over Nest because of the additional sensors. Reliability was high

column2: I try the website but receive the same errors. I have more than 10 devices which I use to monitor our ecobees
column3: and I can reproduce the behavior on all of them.

column1: What‚Äôs especially unhelpful is when demand is high. Being able to control thermostats remotely is the top reason we purchased these units. It does no good when the supporting infrastructure is inadequate. Ecobee has had several major outages
column2: and they only continue in frequency.";"2019-02-14T08:54:51-07:00";"https://itunes.apple.com/us/review?id=916985674&type=Purple%20Software";"916985674";131;"en";"NEGATIVE"

column1: 96;4552548779;"Jimbethesda";"https://itunes.apple.com/us/reviews/id13196763";"7.14.0";1;"Great thermostat
column2: terrible app";"The main flaw with the app is the servers that it connects to.  It is down a lot.  Even if you‚Äôre at home
column3: you connect via their ‚Äúcloud‚Äù and not directly with your thermostats

column1: I was going to change the temperature
column2: but their service is down again
column3: so I wrote this review instead.

column1: ****UPDATE****
Ecobee‚Äôs response is I‚Äôm sorry you couldn‚Äôt connect on Friday.  This is their canned response.  Did they even read my review!!?  Yes it was down ‚Äúon Friday‚Äù
column2: but my review is that it is down ALOT.  And even when it is technically working
column3: there is a long delay.  When you open the app
column4: it displays the last known state.  It then eventually refreshes.  There is no way to tell if what is displayed is correct at first.

column1: So....my suggestions are:
1) Change your architecture to support direct connections to the thermostat when on the same network (example: Pentair‚Äôs Intellicenter)
2) Fire the person responsible for your data center/cloud infrastructure.  Your servers go down way too often.

3) Change the app to either a) Not display any thermostat information until it connects to your servers or b) Display the date and time the data is from.";"2019-08-01T15:20:45-07:00";"https://itunes.apple.com/us/review?id=916985674&type=Purple%20Software";"916985674";199;"en";"POSITIVE"

column1: 100;7706029902;"Coelleen";"https://itunes.apple.com/us/reviews/id188446092";"8.15.0";5;"EcoBee WiFi Thermostat";"This is the VERY best WiFi thermostat on the market IMO.  Not only can you control the thermostat from your phone

column3: relative humidity

column1: This thermostat is also HE. It will analyze your local electrical peaks & valleys of usage and use that data to pre-cool/heat and your home during off-peak times when it‚Äôs cheapest to heat/cool your home.

The thermostat also looks at the relative humidity and auto changes the temperature as humidity affects the way the air feels‚Äîhigher humidity makes the temp feel hotter while a dry house makes it feel cooler.
Lastly
column2: the thermostat learns from your past behaviors and optimizes your efficiency based on those behaviors.

column1: A hard reset and deleting my account appears to have solved the problem for now. I will only use HomeKit to interact with the thermostat and the privacy abuse has me casually the market for a new thermostat.

column2: while I was away. The hard reset appears to have fixed that.";"2019-07-09T13:35:31-07:00";"https://itunes.apple.com/us/review?id=916985674&type=Purple%20Software";"916985674";177;"en";"NEGATIVE"
